com.mvp4g.util.config.loader.annotation
Class Mvp4gAnnotationsLoader<T extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>

java.lang.Object
  com.mvp4g.util.config.loader.annotation.Mvp4gAnnotationsLoader<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
EventsAnnotationsLoader, Mvp4gAnnotationsWithServiceLoader, ServiceAnnotationsLoader
public abstract class Mvp4gAnnotationsLoader<T extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>
extends java.lang.Object

Base class responsible for loading information contained in annotations. All annotation loader must expand this class.

Author:
plcoirier

load

public void load(java.util.List<com.google.gwt.core.ext.typeinfo.JClassType> annotedClasses,
                 Mvp4gConfiguration configuration)
          throws Mvp4gAnnotationException
Load information containing in annotations for each class.

Parameters:
annotedClasses - list of class that are annoted with the annotation
configuration - configuration containing loaded elements of the application
Throws:
Mvp4gAnnotationException - if annotation is not used correctly

addElement

protected <E extends Mvp4gElement> void addElement(java.util.Set<E> loadedElements,
                                                   E element,
                                                   com.google.gwt.core.ext.typeinfo.JClassType c,
                                                   com.google.gwt.core.ext.typeinfo.JMethod m)
                   throws Mvp4gAnnotationException
Add an element to the set and verify first if there is a duplicate.

Type Parameters:
E - type of the element
Parameters:
loadedElements - set where to add the element
element - element to add
c - annoted class that asks for this element to be added (can be null, only for error information purpose)
m - annoted method that ask for this element to be added (can be null, only for error information purpose)
Throws:
Mvp4gAnnotationException - if a duplicate element is already in the list

buildElementNameIfNeeded

protected java.lang.String buildElementNameIfNeeded(java.lang.String currentName,
                                                    java.lang.String className,
                                                    java.lang.String suffix)
Build a name for the element thanks to its class in case the current one is empty or null.

Parameters:
currentName - current name of the element
className - class name of the element
suffix - suffix to add to the element is needed
Returns:
new name of the element if the current name was null or empty, current name otherwise

buildElementName

protected java.lang.String buildElementName(java.lang.String className,
                                            java.lang.String suffix)
Build a name for the element thanks to its class by replacing '.' by '_'. Also add a suffix to the name.

Parameters:
className - class name of the element
suffix - suffix to add at the end of his name
Returns:
name of the element

                                                                         java.lang.String elementClassName)
Find the first element with the corresponding class name and return its name.

Type Parameters:
E - type of the elements
Parameters:
loadedElements - set of elements to look for
elementClassName - name of the class of the seached element
Returns:
name of the element found, null otherwise

                    throws Mvp4gAnnotationException
Control if the class can accept the annotation.

Parameters:
c - class to control
mandatoryInterface - interface that the class must implement
Throws:

Parameters:

getMandatoryInterfaceName

name of the interface that class that has the specific annotation must implement
